New Records: Zack Wheeler earned his 100th career victory.
Key Match Events: Zack Wheeler pitched seven shutout innings.
Edmundo Sosa homered and doubled, driving in two runs.
Trea Turner hit a solo home run.
Michael Harris II made a highlight-reel catch, robbing Austin Hays of a home run.
Jeff Hoffman struck out two in a scoreless eighth inning.
Carlos Estévez completed the shutout with his 23rd save in 27 tries.
Post-Match Reflections: Zack Wheeler expressed pride in his 100th victory, highlighting the hard work and belief in himself and his teams.
Phillies manager Rob Thomson praised Wheeler's performance, noting he was 'locked in tonight'.
Atlanta manager Brian Snitker called Michael Harris II's catch 'probably the catch of the year'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies increased their lead over the Braves in the division to six games.
The game had a sellout crowd of 42,730.
Philadelphia reinstated left-handed reliever José Alvarado from the restricted list after the game.
